title: Two Premier League Clubs Battle It Out For Kasper Schmeichel
text:
Two Premier League Clubs Battle It Out For Kasper Schmeichel Sun Feb 12 2017 21:43:46   21:43:46   
There's every chance that very soon Premier League clubs will be able to pick up a number of Premier League winners for a bargain price and Kasper Schmeichel is top of two teams' lists. 
After yet another defeat, this time to Swansea City, there's a very real chance that Leicester could become only the second team in English football to win the league and be relegated the very next season. 
The Foxes were the most unlikely of Premier League champions only nine months ago but since then it's all gone sour for them and they now sit just one point above relegation and two points from the bottom. 
Should they end up relegated, as is now a very real prospect, then the likes of Riyad Mahrez, Jamie Vardy, Danny Drinkwater and Kasper Schmeichel would all likely be for sale. 
And according to The Star today Schmeichel is a Â£30 million target for both Liverpool and Arsenal in the summer. 
With neither Simon Mignolet or Loris Karius impressing in between the sticks for Liverpool this season it wouldn't be too much of a surprise to see Liverpool try to sign the Dane. 
Arsenal would be more of a surprise seeing as they have Petr Cech. However the former Chelsea number one has looked a little suspect recently. 
The Reds were linked with a move for the goalie in December but Claudio Ranieri was adamant at that point that his keeper wouldn't be moving: 
"He is under contract and we won't sell him under any circumstances. Not even big money. We don't need the money. There's no chance. 
"I'm sorry for Liverpool but they can win the title without Kasper." 
But if the Foxes were to be relegated then they would likely have no option but to sell the son of legendary Manchester United goalie Peter Schmeichel. 
Manchester City have reportedly also shown interest in their former player after Claudio Bravo has failed to live up to expectations this season. Sponsored Links
